translations.translation: Or do they say, 'We are an assembly who will win'?
Or do they say: "We are a well-accoutred army?"
Or do they say: “We are a strong legion, strong enough for victory?”
Do they say, "We shall be victorious because we are united?"
Or they say, “We shall all take revenge as a group.”
Or say they: "We are a great multitude, victorious"
Or do they say: We are a host allied together to help each other?
Or do they say, 'We are a congregation that shall be succoured?'
Or say they: We are a host victorious?
Or do they say, "We are a united group, and we are bound to prevail?"
Or is it that they say: we are a multitude prevailing!
Do they say, ‘We are a confederate league’?
Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
Or do they say: "We are a great multitude, and we shall be victorious?"
Or do they say: 'We are a gathering that will be victorious'
Or do they say, “We are united, and we will be victorious”?
Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?

[54:44] Or do they, the disbelievers of Quraysh, say: ‘We are a host that will be helped to victory’?, against Muhammad (s)? When Abū Jahl, on the day of Badr, said: ‘We are a host that will be helped to victory’, the following was revealed:
(Or say they) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca: (We are a host victorious) and immune from punishment?

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { أَمْ يَقُولُونَ } من كمال حماقتهم، وركاكة رأيهم: { نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ } [القمر: 44] أي: نحن جماعة مجتمعون متفقون، أمرنا واحد، رأينا متفق، ننصر وننتصر بعضنا ببعض، بجيث لا نغالب ولا نرام أصلاً
